com.wounit.rules
Class MockEditingContext

java.lang.Object
  com.webobjects.eocontrol.EOObjectStore
      com.webobjects.eocontrol.EOEditingContext
          er.extensions.eof.ERXEC
              com.wounit.rules.AbstractEditingContextRule
                  com.wounit.rules.MockEditingContext
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.webobjects.eocontrol.EOKeyValueArchiving, com.webobjects.eocontrol.EOObserving, com.webobjects.foundation.NSDisposable, com.webobjects.foundation.NSLocking, Serializable, org.junit.rules.MethodRule
public class MockEditingContext
extends AbstractEditingContextRule

MockEditingContext is a subclass of AbstractEditingContextRule that provides means for fast in-memory testing of EOEnterpriseObjects.

This class is useful for unit testing because it allows the creation of saved objects that don't participate in the augmented transaction process. This kind of feature is useful to validate the behavior of a unit in isolation. 

 public class TestMyModel {
     @Rule
     public MockEditingContext editingContext = new MockEditingContext("MyModel");
 
     @Test
     public void testingMyModelLogic() throws Exception {
        MyEntity instance = MyEntity.createMyEntity(editingContext);
 
        AnotherEntity mockInstance = editingContext.createSavedObject(AnotherEntity.class);
 
        // Do something with instance using the mockInstance...
     }
 }

Since:
1.0
Author:
Henrique Prange
See Also:
Serialized Form

objectWillChange

public void objectWillChange(Object object)
Overrides the implementation inherited from EOEditingContext to not call the super behavior for objects registered with insertSavedObject(EOEnterpriseObject) or createSavedObject(Class).

Specified by:
objectWillChange in interface com.webobjects.eocontrol.EOObserving
Overrides:
objectWillChange in class er.extensions.eof.ERXEC
Parameters:
anObject - the object whose state is to be recorded
See Also:
ERXEC.objectWillChange(java.lang.Object)

saveChanges

public void saveChanges()
Overrides the original method to set a fake EOGlobalID for inserted objects being saved for the first time. A fake permanent EOGlobalID is required to determine if an object was saved or not.

Overrides:
saveChanges in class er.extensions.eof.ERXEC
See Also:
ERXEC.saveChanges()
